lead_paragraph: A Sports of The Times column on Aug. 11, about Michael Phelps’s pursuit of a record eight gold medals in swimming at the Beijing Olympics, misstated his gold-medal count through his first victory of these Games and the number of medals he was behind Mark Spitz’s career total at the time. Phelps had seven — not nine, which was his total for all medals at that point, including two bronze ones from 2004. And he was two medals behind Spitz’s career total, not one. (Phelps ultimately went on to win eight gold medals in Beijing, lifting his career totals to 14 gold and 16 over all.).
